Neocortex primary motor area pyramidal l.DendriteLocation: Basal dendrites branch within neocortical layers 5 and 6; apical dendrite extends across neocortical layers 5-1.
Neocortex primary motor area pyramidal l.Definition: This is a basic type of neocortical cell with a pyramidal-shaped cell body and apical and basal spiny dendrites.  It has an axon that projects subcortically to the spinal cord, giving off collaterals to the thalamus, and local collaterals within the cortex.  It belongs to the group termed infra-telencephalic pyramidal cells.
